metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13684 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Inappropriate implementation in JavaScript in Google Chrome prior to 72.0.3626.81 allowed a remote attacker to leak cross-origin data via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13684` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
